name: Terminate stale looker scheduled jobs from looker console.txt - Info
description: This section informs that only users with administrative privileges have the authority to terminate stale or inactive scheduled jobs from the Looker console user interface. This implies that regular users without admin rights cannot perform this action through the Looker UI.
use_cases: Terminating stale or inactive scheduled jobs
Controlling access and privileges for administrative tasks

name: Terminate stale looker scheduled jobs from looker console.txt - Example Schedule job
description: This section appears to be providing an example of how to schedule a job in Looker, a business intelligence and data visualization platform. However, the section content is incomplete and does not provide any actual code or instructions for scheduling a job.
use_cases: Scheduling recurring data analysis or reporting tasks in Looker
Ensuring timely delivery of business intelligence insights

name: Terminate stale looker scheduled jobs from looker console.txt - Finalize Scheduled Job
description: This section provides a visual representation of the final step in terminating a stale or outdated scheduled job in the Looker console. The image shows the 'Finalize Scheduled Job' button, which, when clicked, will complete the process of stopping the scheduled job from running further. This step ensures that any unnecessary or obsolete scheduled jobs are properly terminated, freeing up resources and maintaining an efficient system.
use_cases: Terminating stale or outdated scheduled jobs
Managing and optimizing scheduled job processes

name: Terminate stale looker scheduled jobs from looker console.txt - Scheduled (stale) job is finalised
description: This section explains how to terminate or finalize a stale scheduled job in the Looker console. It provides step-by-step instructions with screenshots on how to navigate to the Looker admin console, locate the job ID of the stale job, and use the 'Finalize Scheduled Job' option to terminate the job. The process is straightforward and can be followed by anyone with access to the Looker console, even if they are not technical experts.
use_cases: Terminating stale or long-running scheduled jobs in Looker
Freeing up resources by finalizing jobs that are no longer needed
Managing and maintaining scheduled jobs in the Looker console
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with scheduled jobs
capabilities: Identifying job IDs of scheduled jobs
Managing scheduled jobs through the Looker console
